taskbody.context: Some elements require attributes. For example DITA topics require the ID attribute and Docbook ulink requires the url attribute. When you insert such an element, you'll be prompted to specify the required attribute value.

info.p: In the Insert Element Dialog, do one of the following:

step.stepresult: The Required Attributes Dialog will appear.

step.cmd: Specify the value of the required attribute.
step.info: In the Required Attributes Dialog, do the following:

substep.cmd: In the Value field, type the value of the attribute.

step.stepresult: The element will be inserted with the specified attribute value.

example.title: Example. Inserting the ulink element in the ContentMap.
example.p: Suppose we want to insert the ulink element after the orderedlist element in a Docbook document. It is more convenient to find this position in the ContentMap than in the Editing Window.

li.p: Click the empty branch in the ContentMap - the end of the para element.
Let's insert a new element there.
Press Ctrl-Enter to call up the Insert Element Dialog.
In the Insert Element Dialog, select the ulink element.
In the Required Attributes Dialog, enter the value of the url attribute. Click OK .
The ulink element has been inserted.
Type the content of the ulink.
